suppress.notes: file name: okhttp-3.11.0.jar ** DISPUTED ** CertificatePinner.java in OkHttp 3.x through 3.12.0 allows man-in-the-middle attackers to bypass certificate pinning by changing SSLContext and the boolean values while hooking the application. NOTE: This id is disputed because some parties don't consider this is a vulnerability. Their rationale can be found in https://github.com/square/okhttp/issues/4967.
file name: guava-30.1.1-jre.jar Only vulnerable if using com.google.common.io.Files.createTempDir(), which does not appear to be in use and has been marked as deprecated in versions 30.0 and later
file names: okhttp-3.11.0.jar False positive, this vulnerability is for google:android, which is not a dependency
